definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To demonstrate that something is true or viable ; to give proof for; to bear out ; to testify.
examples: I will prove that my method is more effective than yours.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To turn out ; to manifest .
examples: It proved to be a cold day.

definitions.definition: ( copulative ) To turn out to be.
examples: Have an exit strategy should your calculations prove incorrect.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To put to the test , to make trial of.
examples: They took the experimental car to the proving -grounds.
The hypothesis has not been proven to our satisfaction.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To ascertain or establish the genuineness or validity of; to verify.
( printing , dated , transitive ) To take a trial impression of; to take a proof of.
Alternative form of proof ( “ allow (dough) to rise; test the activeness of (yeast); pressure-test (a firearm) ” ) .
( homeopathy ) To determine by experiment which effects a substance causes when ingested .
